event.title: covers an area of 131.89 km² and as of 2006

data.event: The municipality, located in a mountainous area of the country, covers an area of 131.89 km² and as of 2006 has an approximate population of 24,000.
After a flood of that river in 1882, their settlers moved to the present place and founded La Palma.

In 1959 by Legislative Decree, it became a town and municipality, consisting of the cantons of Los Horcones, Los Planes, Las Granadillas, El Gramal, San José Sacaré, El Túnel, El Aguacatal and San Josecalera.
